imbalance.context: The patient is having recurrent attacks of imbalance rather than true vertigo following the history of head trauma and loss of consciousness.

vertigo.context: The patient is having recurrent attacks of imbalance rather than true vertigo following the history of head trauma and loss of consciousness.

head trauma.context: The patient is having recurrent attacks of imbalance rather than true vertigo following the history of head trauma and loss of consciousness.

loss of consciousness.context: The patient is having recurrent attacks of imbalance rather than true vertigo following the history of head trauma and loss of consciousness.

tinnitus.context: Symptoms are not accompanied by tinnitus or deafness.

deafness.context: Symptoms are not accompanied by tinnitus or deafness.

normal MRI.context: Patient had a normal MRI and normal neurological examination on August 24, 2010.

normal neurological examination.context: Patient had a normal MRI and normal neurological examination on August 24, 2010.

intact tympanic membranes.context: Otoscopy: showed bilateral intact tympanic membranes with central Weber test and bilateral positive Rinne.

central Weber test.context: Otoscopy: showed bilateral intact tympanic membranes with central Weber test and bilateral positive Rinne.

positive Rinne.context: Otoscopy: showed bilateral intact tympanic membranes with central Weber test and bilateral positive Rinne.

postural stability with difficulty.context: Romberg Test: maintained postural stability with difficulty.

no spontaneous, end gaze nystagmus.context: Frenzel glasses examination: no spontaneous, end gaze nystagmus.

no positional nystagmus.context: Dix-Hallpike: showed no positional nystagmus excluding benign paroxysmal positional vertigo.

short corrective saccades.context: Head Shaking And Vestibulocular Reflex [Halmagyi Test]: were done with difficulty a short corrective saccades may give the possibility if having a decompensated vestibular hypofunction.

decompensated vestibular hypofunction.context: Head Shaking And Vestibulocular Reflex [Halmagyi Test]: were done with difficulty a short corrective saccades may give the possibility if having a decompensated vestibular hypofunction.

electronystagmography.context: Impression: Decompensation vestibular hypofunction documented by further electronystagmography and caloric testing.

caloric testing.context: Impression: Decompensation vestibular hypofunction documented by further electronystagmography and caloric testing.

vestibular rehabilitation exercises.context: Plan: Booked for electronystagmography and advised to continue with her vestibular rehabilitation exercises, in addition to supportive medical treatment in the form of betahistine 24 mg twice a day.

betahistine.context: Plan: Booked for electronystagmography and advised to continue with her vestibular rehabilitation exercises, in addition to supportive medical treatment in the form of betahistine 24 mg twice a day.
